commit_list.message:
upload_file: Can now specify content_length

The caller can now specify content_length for the file-like object, if
known. Doing so avoids the call to get_file_size(), which would not work
if the file is not seekable.

The result is that a file can be uploaded from a portion of a streamed
HTTP request.
commit_list.repo_description: The Python SDK for the Rackspace Cloud

- Otherwise make a dummy class (to avoid additional testing deep in)

commit_list.message:
Alternate fix for overlay window in Fingertips.

If UIKit asks the overlay window for the root view controller, look
through the application window list for a better candidate for that
controller, and return that instead.

From tracing method calls, UIKit returns the top window that 
"_canAffectStatusBarAppearance", apparently checking the bundle of
the class to see if it's an internal window, checking the screen
of the window, and checking the window level.

Attempts to set the window level to all kinds of numbers had failed.

The previous fix, which overrode the setRootViewController method of the
main window, caused problems with touch events not being delivered to
some apps.
commit_list.repo_description: Touch indicators on external displays for iOS applications.

commit_list.message:
Fix status bar hiding in iOS 7.

It seems that, when calling the new iOS 7 status bar functions, the
application looks for the window with the highest level and works
with that window's rootViewController.

So, echo the window's rootViewController into its overlayWindow.
commit_list.repo_description: Touch indicators on external displays for iOS applications.

commit_list.message:
Avoid unnecessarily decoding body data.

In one case we had, the request body contained JPEG data with UTF-8
violations, causing exceptions.

Since the body is only part of the OAuth signature if it's
www-form-urlencoded, avoid decoding it in other cases.
commit_list.repo_description: Create a secure OAuth provider easily, powered by OAuthLib

commit_list.message:
Instead of returning response objects, raise errors.

Some wrapping decorators (like mimerender) expect dicts, not response
objects.

Raising exceptions for HTTP error responses avoids quirks of the
applications. (This is also what flask.abort() eventually does).
commit_list.repo_description: Create a secure OAuth provider easily, powered by OAuthLib

commit_list.message:
require_oauth decorator was always succeeding.

verify_request() returns a tuple of (valid, oauth_request). The code was
treating it as if it returned just a bool, and since the never-empty
tuple was always truthy, requests always seemed to work.

Fixes ib-lundgren/flask-oauthprovider/#3
commit_list.repo_description: Create a secure OAuth provider easily, powered by OAuthLib

commit_list.message:
Fix: #3479904 Ctags failed to parse objective c .m file in 5.8-1

Included patch from Adrian Lee: http://sourceforge.net/users/lxdiyun/

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&aid=3479904&group_id=6556&atid=106556
commit_list.repo_description: Clone of Exuberant Ctags repo, with patches

commit_list.message:
Create and use a map of expected types as seen in the database

METHOD and STATIC_METHOD both map to "Method" in the database.
Improved parsing distinguishes these in MatchType, and then the test
failed due to mismatched counts.

Calculate a mapping by the type seen in the database to account for the
merged values.
commit_list.repo_description: Generate docsets for Dash from Javadoc

commit_list.message:
Fix up the method counts for testing.

Successfully parsing the index-all.html file distinguished the
METHOD from STATIC_METHOD types, so the counts are reflected here.

Counts verified by examining the index-all.html file.
commit_list.repo_description: Generate docsets for Dash from Javadoc

commit_list.message:
Parse all of the index information from the Javadoc index files.

When climbing up to a parent element because a link is wrapped in a
style tag, also re-fetch the parent's tag name.

Doing so causes methods the check for the <dt> tag to succeed, and
all of the bolded entries in index-all.html are now seen.

Because of this, it is also no longer necessary to search class
files in order to find methods, fields, and constructors.
commit_list.repo_description: Generate docsets for Dash from Javadoc

commit_list.message:
Use the new location for the groovyApiUrl

Codehaus is gone, so point at groovy-lang.org instead.

This fixes waiting for TCP timeouts while building Javadoc.
commit_list.repo_description: Generate docsets for Dash from Javadoc

commit_list.message:
Test stray <a> tag causing warnings on System.err

Javadoc in JDK 8 won't allow these stray <a> tags so manufacture a bad
HTML file by hand.
commit_list.repo_description: Generate docsets for Dash from Javadoc

commit_list.message:
Avoid creating index values for empty name or link path.

This defends against jsoup getting confused if a piece of Javadoc
has unescaped HTML tags in it, especially <a> tags with no end tag
or attributes.

Now, it warns about it, and continues, giving some context so that the
user can go examine their Javadoc and possibly correct it.
commit_list.repo_description: Generate docsets for Dash from Javadoc

commit_list.message:
Finally changed the servo speed scaling to 1.

The servos are not linear, and don’t really cover the range 0 to 1.
Tried reducing the scaling for smoothness in steering, so it wouldn’t
oversteer, but with the steering algorithm improvements it didn’t seem
necessary.

- Takes an input document, puts a thin red box around every character,
  and writes an output document.

commit_list.message:
FillFormTest: Add function to check to see if before pdfjt version 4

- PDFJT version 4.0.0-SNAPSHOT and up fix up a case where "null"
  was replaced with empty string for certain fields.
- Code will have to check output depending on which version of PDFJT
  was used.
- Version number of PDFJT is retrieved from version.properties. It would
  be nice if the Version class in PDFJT gave a cleaner way to the raw
  version number, but that would have had to be done earlier.
- Maven DefaultArtifactVersion class is used for its version-comparing
  skills.

commit_list.message:
Add new lite project

- This is the project that will ship with the main PDFJT distribution

This project actually is its own meta-project; it can create itself.
To do that, run with the generate-distribution profile.

- It automatically retrieves the sources from the parent directory,
  but only the sources for the "basic" set of samples, their
  resources and tests.
- Tests and integration tests (if the integration-tests profile is
  active) are run.
- Makes a zip file with the distributed-samples classifier that contains
  the main sources and resources, but not the tests and their resources.
- The distributed-samples zip contains the lite pom.xml from this
  directory.

commit_list.message:
Move the compile-time dependencies to the front of the list.

- For transitive dependencies, listing the compile dependencies first
  biases dependency resolution in favor of compile-time requirements
  over test-time requirements.
- This is needed to get the correct version of xml-apis.

known.

Fix up integration test stack traces

  method.
- Don't trim the stack traces by turning off stack tracing in the POM
- Unwrap InvocationTargetException to reveal the actual exception from
  the main program.

commit_list.message:
POM: Make sure to skip integration tests in the Surefire plugin

Tests ending in IntegrationTest also end in Test, so make sure they're
excluded from the test search.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message:
Add test suites to run AllIntegrationTests or AllUnitTests

There is no project setting to keep Eclipse from running all the tests.

Therefore, two test suites are provided, AllIntegrationTests and
AllUnitTests.

Developers will normally want to select AllUnitTests and run those
as JUnit tests. This will run just the unit tests, and not the
integration tests.

Note that running the whole package as a JUnit test will run all the
tests *twice*, once individually, and once as a suite.

Remembering to add tests to the test suites is hard, so unit-toolbox
is used to create test suites via wildcards based on the test class
names.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message:
POM: Run the integration tests in the integration-tests profile

To run the integration tests, do

mvn verify -P integration-tests

The Jenkins builders will be set up to run integration tests.

By default, they won't take up developers' time when run from the
command line.

The integration tests are run with the classpath set to the
packaged jar. To ensure that the integration tests are in a clean
environment, the target/classes directory is deleted, and the tests
are run with the current directory set to
target/integration-test-outputs.

Note that this means that running the integration tests may mean that
you have to rebuild the project in Eclipse before things run again.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message:
Add an integration test to run all the main methods from the jar.

Integration tests happen during the integration-test and verify phases
in Maven. They're designed to run the built package in a constructed
environment.

The reflections package is used as a helper to find all the classes
in the current package, and then all of the main methods in each
class. A parameterized test is then created and run for each main
method.

This only tests that the samples will work from the jar. The unit
tests verify that the sample methods work correctly.

commit_list.message:
PrintPdf: Throw a PrinterIOException

- Making an IOException is the only known way to chain an exception
  into the printing logic to keep PMD, the printing logic, and checked
  exceptions all happy at the same time.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message:
PrintPdf: If there is an error rasterizing a page, make sure to throw

- No guarantees that the PageRasterizer will behave once it's in an
  error state
- Log full exception to log, and throw a PrinterException referencing
  the log (not possible to attach a Throwable to a PrinterException)
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message:
PrintPdfTest: requires JRE 1.7

- Using JRE 1.8 results in different image checksums.
- This seems to stem from differences in CMYK to RGB conversion during
  rasterization. It may involve color conversion done by the JRE,
  but that has not been proved.
- Test assumes JRE 1.7 series, so will be skipped when run with a
  different JRE.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message:
Fix calculation order in XFDF form-filling example.

- Calculate the calculatedNumber before any of the barcodes, so that the
  barcodes include the correct value as they aggregate up other fields.
- This used to seem to work before when the form data fortuitously was
  the same as the result of calculation. Minor formatting changes in the
  calculation, and deliberate changes to the input file showed up the
  longstanding problem with the sample PDF file.
- Acrobat shows the same misbehavior if you, say, import the form and
  inspect the barcode value, or save the PDF and inspect the values
  stored in the PDF.

- This makes the content dump baselines work correctly on Windows.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message: Re-baseline sample outputs using the content dumper.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

commit_list.message:
SampleTest: Get page contents using the dumper.

- The dumper supports converting Type 0 subsets to Unicode strings in
  dumps, which will support new functionality in Talkeetna.
- Dumper includes text state and font.
- Dumper differences will be easier to compare, as the entire state
  is in the dump. In a content stream, some of the state is in other
  objects.
- Conversion of text file line endings from LF to CR no longer needed.
commit_list.repo_description: Sample code for Datalogics PDF Java Toolkit.

Creation samples: Prefer Microsoft Core Fonts.

- These can be reliably reproduced on different platforms (Mac vs
  Linux) when the fonts are subsetted.

Fixed issue 316: StringException is not in IronPython 2.6

- Compatibility: Only import StringException if IronPython < 2.6

- Otherwise make a dummy class (to avoid additional testing deep in)

commit_list.repo_description: A wrapper for 10.6 associated object API

commit_list.message:
upload_file: Can now specify content_length

The caller can now specify content_length for the file-like object, if
known. Doing so avoids the call to get_file_size(), which would not work
if the file is not seekable.

The result is that a file can be uploaded from a portion of a streamed
HTTP request.
commit_list.repo_description: Heat fork of pyrax

commit_list.message: Increment version numbers to 0.97p4.

Fix a bug parsing Java files for their class names.

- DLEViewer source with a new double array at the end put the scanner in
  strange states looking for a class name.

- Solution is to make digits followed by '.' their own token, so that
  floating point constants don't make the scanner think a qualified
  class/package name is present.
Update version numbers to 0.97p2

Use vsvarsall.bat to get environment values, instead of user prefs.

If it is possible to deduce the locations of VSINSTALLDIR and
VCINSTALLDIR, then run the vsvarsall.bat file in a subprocess with a
stripped down environment.

Get the values of LIB, INCLUDE, PATH, and LIBPATH from that
subprocess' environment.

This means we don't fish around in the registry and try to read things
from the user's XML settings file. The XML settings are a lot to
parse, and using them means a change in the IDE settings could affect
batch builds, which would be bad. It also saves a lot of time.

It also means that the SCons environment setting MSVS8_PLATFORM can
determine which platform we build for, as it is passed to the
vsvarsall.bat file. So if we were to set MSVS8_PLATFORM='x86_amd64' in
an Environment() constructor, we'd be compiling with the 64-bit
tools. Thus, a lot of mess could be cleaned out of the DevTests'
SConstruct.

And we'd be using the environment settings that makefiles and batch
scripts end up using.

Copied from: svn+ssh://svn.dlogics.com/svn/dev/Packages/scons-local/trunk@31940
Change version to 0.97p1 for a Datalogics release.

Improvements to virtualenv patch; works on Windows now.

- Fix indent of patch block so it works on all OSes.

- Get a specific version of SCons from pkg_resources.

- Put SCons we found in pkg_resources at the front of the list.

Wrap the passed-in exitstatfunc around the one on the Action
Object, so that the Action object's exitstatfunc has first crack
at changing the meaning of the status.


git-svn-id: svn+ssh://svn.dlogics.com/svn/dev/Packages/scons/trunk@20632 a347f3a1-5518-0410-bf23-827ba1738e83
Increment version numbers to 0.97p3.

msvc: Clean up temporary batch and pickle files.

Getting the Visual Studio configuration environment variables creates a
temporary batch file and pickle file as a side effect. These are now
cleaned up.

Make msvc tool work better with VS2008.

- Pass a more complete environment to the batch script, with COMSPEC,
  TMP, TEMP, and other system variables, and a path that includes
  Windows system directories. VS2008 uses some complex commands in its
  scripting.

- Just let the script output come out rather than trying to buffer it.

Copied from: svn+ssh://svn.dlogics.com/svn/dev/Packages/scons-local/trunk@31953

Fix scons.bat to work in a virtualenv.

If it finds python.exe and scons adjacent to the batch file, it uses
those. That is the situation when the .bat file, python.exe, and the
virtualenv-generated scons script are all in the virtualenv\Scripts
directory together.

Apply patch to make SCons work from inside a virtualenv.

Applied this patch:

http://scons.tigris.org/nonav/issues/showattachment.cgi/404/scons.patch

in accordance with this bug repot:

http://scons.tigris.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=2051

Cherry-pick change from r1927 in

http://scons.tigris.org/svn/scons/branches/core/src/engine/SCons/Tool/JavaCommon.py

Issue 1658:  Find Java anonymous classes when the next token after
the name is an open parenthesis.  (Jan Nijtmans)

This fixes a parsing problem with the ViewerFrame.java source in DLE.


git-svn-id: svn+ssh://svn.dlogics.com/svn/dev/Packages/scons/trunk@23514 a347f3a1-5518-0410-bf23-827ba1738e83

Fix up problems with inappropriate detection of MSVS and MIDL on non-Windows boxes.


git-svn-id: svn+ssh://svn.dlogics.com/svn/dev/Packages/scons/trunk@23463 a347f3a1-5518-0410-bf23-827ba1738e83

Cache the results from _parse_msvc8_overrides. This saves a lot of time
parsing that big XML file with the user prefs in it, since we try to get
the preferred library paths many times during the course of a build.
